headline: A Sample Post
author: J.Downing

para1.value: This post was created to show off some of the editing features available in the engine. If you noticed, all you can really do to the main document is add effects. Once a section has been added other things can be added to the level. This text you reading right now is inside a section, however it simple had no heading entered above it. If you click in the area on the top of this paragraph (just above the line) you will see the place were one can be added. Sections are required for text because they help form the table of contents later.

7_1414767916692.value: Here is an example of a section with a heading. Notice where this heading is located above the line. By clicking in this area you can change the heading or remove it completely. When you do, your final document will adjust to the lack of heading and assume it was just a new blank section of your document.

8_1414768124984.value: I can add more paragraphs inside of a section. This is really handy whenever you are writing tutorials or documentation that needs organization. Sections can also contain code blocks and images. Let's put in an image next.

10_1414768368092.value: As you can see, images are sized automatically to fit the display area the best they can. Images also have captions below them. To change the caption you can click on it and change the text. It will automatically save once you click or tab away.

12_1414772528992.value: You can also add code snippets to a section. When you add a code snippet you can either use the edit box to paste your snippet, or upload a code file to sling and point the box to it by using a special syntax.

16_1414773336409.value: We can also just point to a file in the JCR using its path if we want to. To do this we need to prefix the file path inside the box and remove the rest of the content. When we do the box will be replaced with the contents from that area. Editing these types of boxes won't be allowed once they have been created.
